title: Medical Device Usability Evaluation: Theory and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Learners engage in a blended-methodology usability evaluation process using personal devices (BYOD) and apply their skills to real-world scenarios through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Explain core principles of medical device usability evaluation according to EN 62366 standards
Conduct usability testing projects applying both quantitative (performance metrics, SUS/TFQ surveys) and qualitative (interviews, open responses) data collection methods
Propose medical device design improvements based on synthesized usability test results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
